citation.article-title: Roseovarius indicus sp. nov., isolated from deep-sea water of the Indian Ocean
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Roseovarius indicus sp. nov.
Roseovarius indicus (in′di.cus. L. adj. indicus Indian, referring to the Indian Ocean, where the strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-reaction-negative, non-motile, short rods, 1.7–2.4×1.0–1.1 µm.

Positive for catalase and oxidase activities and nitrate reduction, but negative for indole production, urease, lipase (Tween 80), gelatinase, β-glucosidase, β-galactosidase and arginine dihydrolase activities, glucose fermentation, denitrification and hydrolysis of aesculin.
On 216L agar, strain B108T produces smooth colonies with regular edges that are 2–3 mm in diameter after 72h of incubation at 28 °C.
Colonies are opaque, white to faintly pink in the centre, non-pigmented and slightly raised in the centre.
Grows in 1–15 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 3–5 %) and at 10–39 °C (optimum 25 °C), but not at 4 or 40 °C after 1 week.
Principal fatty acids were C16 : 0, C16 : 0 2-OH, summed feature 8 (C18 : 1ω7c/ω6c) and C19 : 0ω8c cyclo.
The major respiratory quinone was ubiquinone 10 (Q10).
Phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and some unidentified compounds were detected.

Sensitive to [µg per disk (OXOID), unless stated otherwise]: ampicillin (10), carbenicillin (100), cefalexin (30), cefazolin (30), cefobid (30), cephradin (30), chloromycetin (30), ciprofloxacin (5), furazolidone (15), gentamicin (10), kanamycin (30), minomycin (30), norfloxacin (10), penicillin G (10), piperacillin (100), rifampicin (5), rocephin (30), vancomycin (30); resistant to clindamycin (2), Co-trimoxazole (25), erythromycin (15), lincomycin (2), metronidazole (5), neomycin (10), ofloxacin (5), oxacillin (1), polymyxin B (30 IU), streptomycin (10), tetracycline (30) and vibramycin (30).

In API ZYM tests: positive for acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine aminopeptidase, naphthol-AS-Bl-phosphohydrolase and valine aminopeptidase; weakly positive for lipase (C14); negative for cystine aminopeptidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-fucosidase, α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and β-glucuronidase.
Negative for utilization of all 12 carbon sources in API 20 NE tests.
Characteristics used to distinguish strain B108T from related species are shown in Table 1.
The type strain, B108T ( = 2PR52-14T = CCTCC AB 208233T = LMG 24622T = MCCC 1A01227T), was isolated from deep-sea water of the Indian Ocean.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.6 mol%.
